poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text:
Was time the wind? That
Whiled and whittled us
Away? The ricochet whined,
Plumbing a space so wide I knew
I never - for all they'd wired me up to reckon
And wind me up to do - never stood in their
Crosshairs saying 'cheese',
Wild fear flung into reverse
Being what I had.
